REST controller that provides comprehensive event management APIs with filtering, pagination, sorting, and CRUD operations for the OpenFrame platform.

## Key Components

**Main Class:**
- `EventController` - REST controller handling all event-related HTTP endpoints

**Dependencies:**
- `EventService` - Core business logic service for event operations
- `EventMapper` - Maps between domain objects and DTOs

**Endpoints:**
- `GET /api/v1/events` - Query events with advanced filtering and cursor pagination
- `GET /api/v1/events/{id}` - Retrieve specific event by ID
- `POST /api/v1/events` - Create new event
- `PUT /api/v1/events/{id}` - Update existing event
- `GET /api/v1/events/filters` - Get available filter options

**Key Features:**
- Cursor-based pagination with configurable limits (1-100)
- Multi-criteria filtering (user IDs, event types, date ranges, search terms)
- Flexible sorting with field and direction options
- Comprehensive OpenAPI documentation with Swagger annotations
- Request tracking via user ID and API key headers

## Usage Example

```java
// Query events with filtering and pagination
@GetMapping
public EventsResponse getEvents(
    @RequestParam(required = false) List<String> userIds,
    @RequestParam(required = false) List<String> eventTypes,
    @RequestParam(required = false) LocalDate startDate,
    @RequestParam(required = false) LocalDate endDate,
    @RequestParam(required = false) String cursor,
    @RequestParam(defaultValue = "20") @Min(1) @Max(100) Integer limit) {
    
    // Build filter criteria
    EventFilterCriteria filterCriteria = EventFilterCriteria.builder()
        .userIds(userIds)
        .eventTypes(eventTypes)
        .startDate(startDate)
        .endDate(endDate)
        .build();
    
    // Execute query with service layer
    var result = eventService.queryEvents(
        eventMapper.toEventFilterOptions(filterCriteria),
        eventMapper.toCursorPaginationCriteria(paginationCriteria),
        search,
        eventMapper.toSortInput(sortCriteria));
        
    return eventMapper.toEventsResponse(result);
}

// Create new event
@PostMapping
@ResponseStatus(CREATED)
public EventResponse createEvent(@RequestBody Event event) {
    Event createdEvent = eventService.createEvent(event);
    return eventMapper.toEventResponse(createdEvent);
}
```
